title: Wagner Chief Appears to Backtrack on Threat to Pull Fighters From Bakhmut
description: Yevgeny V. Prigozhin said his mercenaries had been promised the ammunition and equipment they needed and would not have to withdraw from Russia’s fight for the eastern Ukrainian city.
author: Neil MacFarquhar, Matthew Mpoke Bigg and Andrés R. Martínez

title: Ukrainians Return Home, Renewed and Resigned
description: More than 5.5 million people who left after the war began in February 2022 have gone back home — and not just to large cities like Kyiv or Dnipro, but to small places near the front line, as well.
author: Jeffrey Gettleman and Finbarr O’Reilly

title: Arab League Votes to Readmit Syria, Ending a Nearly 12-Year Suspension
description: The country is poised for a triumphant return this month at the league’s next summit — perhaps represented by President Bashar al-Assad, the Syrian leader accused of committing war crimes against his own people.
author: Vivian Yee
categories: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

title: At Charles’s Coronation, Everything Olde Was New Again
description: The king promised a thoroughly 21st-century ceremony, but when push came to shove, he took his place on a 13th-century throne.
author: Sarah Lyall
categories: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

title: Dutch Police Arrest 154 Soccer Fans Over Antisemitic Chants
description: Though the Netherlands’ Jewish population is tiny, Jewish identity — and antisemitic abuse — has become entangled in the country’s soccer culture.
author: Claire Moses

title: ​Leaders of Japan and South Korea Vow to Deepen Ties
description: As Japan’s prime minister failed to deliver a direct apology for the era of colonial rule, South Korea’s president urged his nation to focus on present problems, not history.
author: Choe Sang-Hun and Motoko Rich

title: The Forces Behind South Korea’s and Japan’s Thaw
description: Eras of grievances between the two countries are giving way under the pressure of global changes, and with help from a personal outreach approach by both leaders.
author: Choe Sang-Hun

title: Did China Help Vancouver’s Mayor Win Election?
description: Ken Sim, Vancouver’s first mayor of Chinese descent, rejects claims of Chinese interference and says his landslide win was due to his tireless campaigning and more appealing policies.
author: Dan Bilefsky

title: Charles Is Crowned King in Ancient Ceremony With Modern Twists
description: The coronation, the first since Queen Elizabeth II’s in 1953, was a royal spectacle of the kind that only Britain still stages.
author: Mark Landler
categories: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom
Camilla, Queen Consort of the United Kingdom
Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain

title: The 2 Israels: Court Crisis Is Front Line for Dueling Visions of a Nation’s Future
description: For many Israelis, their country’s future rests on the fate of a government plan to overhaul the courts. In a remote part of northeastern Israel, ethnic and religious differences among Jews show why the issue has become so important.
author: Patrick Kingsley

title: ‘I See No Future’: Sherpas Leave the Job They Made Famous
description: Perils of the job and a scant safety net are pushing climbing guides to leave the industry and ensure the next generation has other options.
author: Bhadra Sharma and Mujib Mashal

title: Serbia Reflects on Gun Ownership After Mass Shootings
description: Back-to-back massacres have forced the country, still in mourning, to grapple with its complicated and long gun tradition.
author: Constant Méheut

title: Ukraine Faces Pressure Over Counteroffensive, as Putin Bides His Time
description: Ukraine is feeling short-term pressure from its Western backers for success in a looming counteroffensive. Vladimir Putin seems to be operating on a longer timeline.
author: Paul Sonne and Andrew E. Kramer

title: Car Bombing Injures Russian Nationalist Prilepin, State Media Reports
description: Zakhar Prilepin, who himself fought in eastern Ukraine, has long advocated an imperialist foreign policy by Moscow.
author: Neil MacFarquhar and Anton Troianovski

title: Homemade, Cheap and Lethal, Attack Drones Are Vital to Ukraine
description: Fighting superior Russian firepower, Ukrainian forces turn off-the-shelf drones into deadly weapons by adapting them to carry explosives.
author: Andrew E. Kramer

title: Flamenco and Fervor: Inside Spain’s El Rocío Pilgrimage
description: The annual spectacle, featuring fanciful caravans and riders on horseback, and is arguably the most potent visual representation of Andalusian culture.
author: Kevin Faingnaert and Anna Hart

title: George Berkeley’s Name Removed from Trinity College Dublin Library
description: No one disputes that George Berkeley was among Ireland’s greatest thinkers, but he was also an unapologetic slaver. Now, time has caught up with him.
author: Ed O’Loughlin

title: At Least 22 Dead After Tourist Boat Capsizes in Southern India
description: Many victims of the tragedy in the state of Kerala were children who were sightseeing on a boat that officials said was overcrowded.
author: Sameer Yasir

title: Deaths of Seniors in Hospital Fire Point to China’s Elder Care Shortfall
description: The country’s supply of nursing home beds has not kept pace with its rapidly aging population, leading some families to seek unlicensed alternatives.
author: Vivian Wang and Joy Dong

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Currents of change in Britain.
author: Natasha Frost

title: Coronation and Election Leave Restless U.K. ‘in a Waiting Room’
description: Beneath the gilded continuity of the coronation celebrations, there were signs that both Britain and its royal family are preparing for a new era.
author: Mark Landler
categories: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom
Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain

title: Your Monday Briefing: Kishida Visits Seoul
description: Also, the U.S. braces for a surge of immigrants this week.
author: Amelia Nierenberg
categories: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

title: Who’s a Good Boy? Ask These Westminster Judges.
description: For these canine experts, an invitation to pick the winners of the Westminster Dog Show is an honor — and a serious responsibility.
author: Emily Anthes

title: ‘The Glory’ Was a Hit. Now Netflix Is Spending More on K-Dramas.
description: As the series, which focuses on bullying and revenge, became the latest global sensation to emerge from South Korea, Netflix announced it would spend $2.5 billion more on Korean content.
author: Jin Yu Young and Matt Stevens

title: How the Allen, Texas Mall Shooting Unfolded
description: A gunman killed at least eight people at a mall in Texas yesterday.
author: the staff of The Morning

title: As king, Charles inherits untold riches, and passes control of his own vast holdings to William.
author: Jane Bradley and Euan Ward

title: Queen Camilla Seems Lighter in Her New Role
description: The coronation was not just the moment Charles finally ascended to a role in wait for his whole life, but also the final act in the long rehabilitation of the former Camilla Parker Bowles.
author: Sarah Lyall

title: London Police Arrest Dozens of Protesters on Day of Coronation
description: Prior to the coronation, the police had said that there would be little tolerance for disruptive protests. On the day itself, more than 50 people were arrested, most on offenses that appeared to be connected to protests.
author: Emma Bubola and Megan Specia

title: Jamaica Could Become a Republic in 2024. What Will That Look Like?
description: The Commonwealth country has scheduled a referendum in 2024 on whether to cut ties to the British monarchy, opening up a debate on how to reshape the society.
author: Emiliano Rodríguez Mega

title: Judith Miller, ‘Antiques Roadshow’ Mainstay, Is Dead at 71
description: Known for her many guidebooks, she helped determine what was trash and what was treasure on the BBC series that inspired the American show.
author: Penelope Green

title: Were William and Kate Late to the Coronation?
description: The Prince and Princess of Wales arrived at Westminster Abbey after King Charles III, prompting speculation among the many journalists covering the ceremony.
author: Michael M. Grynbaum
categories: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

title: At the Coronation, Harry and William Find Themselves Rows Apart
description: The sons of King Charles III did not appear to interact during their father’s coronation.
author: Sarah Lyall
categories: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

title: Dozens Killed in Ethnic Clashes in India’s Manipur State
description: Violence erupted over a question of who gets to claim special tribal status.
author: Alex Travelli and Suhasini Raj

title: In Australia, He Was a ‘Great Father.’ Secretly, He Was an Escaped Convict.
description: New DNA evidence helped confirm that a man who went by John Damon and died in Australia in 2010 was actually William Leslie Arnold, a convicted killer and escaped inmate from Nebraska.
author: Jesus Jiménez

title: What Happened at King Charles’s Coronation: Key Moments
description: The lavish ceremony for Britain’s first new reigning monarch in 70 years, was brimming with ancient traditions with a few modern touches.
author: The New York Times
categories: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

title: The Coronation of King Charles III, in Photos
description: As Britain’s King Charles III is crowned, here’s a selection of the best photographs from the coronation weekend.
author: The New York Times
categories: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom
Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain

title: Map: King Charles’s Coronation Procession Route
description: His route is markedly shorter than the one taken by Queen Elizabeth II in 1953.
author: Lazaro Gamio

title: Gordon Lightfoot’s Death Is a Loss That Feels Personal
description: Lightfoot’s music created the soundtrack for the daily life of many Canadian families.
author: Shawna Richer

title: Ukraine Claims It Shot Down Russia’s Most Sophisticated Missile for First Time
description: The air force said it intercepted the hypersonic missile with a newly delivered U.S.-made Patriot air-defense battery. U.S. officials confirmed the strike.
author: Marc Santora, Eric Schmitt and John Ismay
categories: United States Defense and Military Forces

title: It’s Coronation Day
description: Come for the crown jewels and gold stagecoach; stay for the questions about the monarchy’s relevance.
author: Melissa Kirsch

title: Canadians Greet King Charles’s Coronation With Muted Response
description: The king’s representative in Canada, where he is head of state, recently appealed to people in the country to “give him a chance.”
author: Vjosa Isai
categories: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

title: Share Your Thoughts on the Crowning of King Charles III
description: The New York Times invites readers to share their comments and observations about the coronation of Britain’s King Charles III.
author: The New York Times

title: Anti-Monarchists Protest Charles’s Coronation
description: Supporters of an elected head of state for Britain see the coronation as an opportunity to highlight the absurdity of having a royal family in the 21st century.
author: Emma Bubola
categories: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

title: King Charles’s Coronation: Key Timings and What Will Happen
description: After the coronation service at Westminster Abbey, King Charles III and other members of the royal family will make an appearance on the balcony of Buckingham Palace.
author: Isabella Kwai
categories: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

title: More than 13,000 Evacuated as Wildfires Burn in Western Canada
description: Government officials declared a provincial state of emergency as more than 100 wildfires burned across Alberta on Saturday, with dozens still “out of control.”
author: Mike Ives and Lauren McCarthy

title: Your Coronation Briefing
description: A special edition on King Charles III.
author: Natasha Frost
categories: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

title: Warring Parties in Sudan to Hold Talks in Saudi Arabia
description: American officials say they hope representatives of two rival Sudanese generals will agree to an enduring cease-fire and to allow humanitarian aid into the country.
author: Edward Wong and Abdi Latif Dahir
categories: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

title: Russian Unease Over Ukraine War Grows Amid Attacks and Leadership Rifts
description: With a Ukrainian offensive looming, explosions in Crimea and inside Russia have rattled Moscow, sparking bureaucratic infighting among military commanders.
author: Neil MacFarquhar

title: They refused to fight for Russia. The law did not treat them kindly.
description: Since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine, hundreds of Russian men have faced criminal charges for becoming war refuseniks. That has not stopped others from going to unusual lengths to avoid battle.
author: Neil MacFarquhar

title: How Could AI Change War? U.S. Defense Experts Warn About New Tech
description: U.S. national security officials are warning about the potential for the new technology to upend war, cyber conflict and — in the most extreme case — the use of nuclear weapons.
author: David E. Sanger
categories: United States Defense and Military Forces
Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament

title: Yevgeny Prigozhin Becomes a Player in Russia After Years in the Shadows
description: Yevgeny V. Prigozhin has used his leadership of the Wagner mercenary force and social media to turn brutality into a personal brand.
author: Anton Troianovski and Ben Shpigel

title: Jill Biden Greets Children and Veterans in London Ahead of King Charles Coronation
description: Dr. Biden attended several events on Friday with Akshata Murty, the wife of Britain’s prime minister, Rishi Sunak.
author: Megan Specia

title: What I’m Reading: Coronation Edition
description: Royal bodies, royal traitors
categories: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

title: What’s Behind Serbia’s Gun Violence
description: Serbia has one of the highest rates of gun ownership in the world, after the Balkan wars left the country awash in weapons.
author: Cora Engelbrecht

title: Palestinians Demand Israel Hand Over Body of Prominent Prisoner
description: Israel’s refusal to hand over the remains of Khader Adnan has drawn scrutiny of the country’s practice of keeping bodies as leverage to bargain for Israeli remains.
author: Raja Abdulrahim

title: Why So Many Nations in the King’s Realm Want to Say Goodbye
description: Whether through a hard break or a soft fade in ties, nations that have kept the British monarch as their head of state are moving toward separation.
author: Damien Cave
categories: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

title: How 2 Students Rescued Dozens of People from the Fighting in Sudan
description: As feuding generals turned the Sudanese capital into a war zone, two university students navigated a battered Toyota through the chaos and saved at least 60 desperate people.
author: Declan Walsh

title: Ferdinand Habsburg Would Have Been King. Instead He’s a Racecar Driver.
description: If the Austro-Hungarian Empire still existed, 25-year-old Ferdinand Habsburg would eventually be its ruler. Instead he’s a racecar driver.
author: Alyson Krueger

title: Where Should a King Sit? A 700-Year-Old Chair Will Do.
description: The Coronation Chair, on which King Charles III will sit for part of his ceremony on Saturday, is getting a touch-up. It hasn’t been used since Queen Elizabeth II’s coronation in 1953.
author: Derrick Bryson Taylor
categories: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom
Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain

title: W.H.O. Ends Covid World Health Emergency Designation
description: The decision has little practical effect but is a significant moment in the struggle against a virus that has killed millions and upended lives throughout the world.
author: Stephanie Nolen

title: Queen Camilla and the Triumph of Image Transformation
description: After the death of Diana, Princess of Wales, there was a sense among many in Britain that “We can’t have Camilla.” But a successful branding overhaul has brought her a significant mark of acceptance.
author: Megan Specia
categories: Camilla, Queen Consort of the United Kingdom
Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

title: Iraqi Man Accused of War Crimes Is Arrested in Belgium
description: The man is believed to have been part of a Qaeda terrorist cell that was partly responsible for bombings that killed at least 376 people in Iraq in 2009 and 2010.
author: Emma Bubola and Alissa J. Rubin
categories: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
